[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [External usage] [Share decryption] When DecryptPrivKey is used to decrypt shares, is the decryption process verifiable, or can malicious validators claim decryption failures to disrupt DKG? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [External usage] [Key registration] Can validators register encryption keys without proving knowledge of the corresponding decryption key, enabling them to participate in DKG without being able to decrypt their share? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: Hash for EncryptPubKey] [Cross-platform] Are hash values deterministic across different architectures (x86, ARM, different endianness), or can hash mismatches cause consensus failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Serialization determinism] Is serialization guaranteed to be deterministic for all valid keys, or can floating-point operations or non-deterministic encoding cause validators to disagree on key representations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Function: as_group_element()] [Internal representation] Can differences in internal point representation (projective vs affine coordinates) cause non-deterministic behavior across validators? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Concept: DLOG assumption] [Weak parameters] Can attackers exploit weak elliptic curve parameters or small subgroup sizes to solve discrete log problems faster than expected, recovering private keys? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Concept: DLOG assumption] [Quantum attacks] Are the encryption schemes quantum-resistant, or can future quantum adversaries break DLOG to recover all historical decryption keys and reconstruct dealt secrets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Struct: EncryptPubKey] [Point validation] Beyond subgroup membership, are points validated to not be exceptional points (e.g., points at infinity, degenerate cases) that could break security proofs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Key strength] Is there a minimum entropy requirement for generated decryption keys, or can weak RNG states produce low-entropy keys vulnerable to brute force? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Cryptographic construction] [Security reduction] Is there a formal security proof that the DLOG-based encryption scheme is IND-CPA secure under DLOG assumption, or are there unknown vulnerabilities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Derive: Eq for EncryptPubKey] [Reflexivity] Does the Eq implementation properly maintain reflexivity (a == a), transitivity, and symmetry, or can broken equality cause HashMap corruption? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Derive: SerializeKey/DeserializeKey] [Format stability] Are serialization formats version-stable, or can format changes across Aptos upgrades cause validators running different versions to disagree on key encodings? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Trait: Length for DecryptPrivKey] [Length consistency] Does length() always return DECRYPT_KEY_NUM_BYTES, or can it return different values causing buffer allocation mismatches? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Struct fields] [Alignment] Can struct field alignment issues cause padding bytes to contain uninitialized memory that leaks key material during serialization? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/encryption_dlog.rs] [Struct: EncryptPubKey] [Concurrent hashing] Can concurrent calls to Hash::hash() on the same EncryptPubKey cause data races if internal state is mutated? (Low)
